image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Meghan Markle wraps filming Netflix cooking show: Another royal reveal?
item.description: ​When Harry and Meghan signed the deal with Netflix, they released a statement saying: "Our lives, both independent of each other and as a couple, have allowed us to understand the power of the human spirit: of courage, resilience, and the need for connection." ​Meghan has already unveiled her new business venture America Riviera Orchard -- a lifestyle brand under which she intends to sell an array of products -- jam, skincare, make-up, gardening supplies, dog food, scented candles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden choked like dog, Kamala Harris 'highly talented': Donald Trump's 4th July message
item.description: The social media post came hours after Trump called Biden a "broken down pile of crap" in a leaked video. Sitting in a golf cart -- with his son Barron Trump on his side -- Trump was seen holding a wad of cash asking a group of individuals how he performed in the debate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian economist N K Singh is conferred honorary fellowship by LSE
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: When did Biden have last medical check-up? There are theories
item.description: Biden leads a healthy lifestyle -- he is a teetotal, exercises regularly and doesn't smoke. According to his physician, Biden exercises five times a week. He also plays golf. As far as the diet is concerned, Biden prefers carbs over greens, has a sweet tooth, enjoys peanut butter and jam sandwiches, biscuits, ice cream sundaes. Other favorites include bacon, lettuce and tomato sandwiches and pizza. His choice of drink is orange Gatorade.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Switzerland tries to flatten out peaks of Alpine visitors
item.description: Switzerland’s tourism agency aims to balance tourist flow by promoting off-seasons and lesser-known destinations. Chief Martin Nydegger and Damian Constantin note localized surges and the impact of a strong franc and high costs limiting mass tourism. Generating 43 billion francs (4.5 percent of GDP), autumn tourism and Davos-Klosters luxury tours are promoted using Chinese influencers and survey-backed positive opinions.

item.title: UK woman murdered parents in 2019, lived with their bodies for 5 years
item.description: ​An elderly couple missed their appointments for years and when the doctors found out that something was amiss, they were already dead for five years. Throughout these years, their daughter told them her parents were either unwell or away on some trips. The daughter, UK's Virginia McCullough, Thursday pleaded guilty to the murders of her parents -- John and Lois McCullough -- who were both in their 70s when they were killed in 201.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: British teacher jailed for sex with schoolboys
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nathan's Hotdog Eating Contest winner is Miki Sudo with 51 dogs in 10 minutes
item.description: ​Defending champion Miki Sudo retained the women's title at the annual Nathan's Hot Dog Eating contest Thursday with a record-breaking 51 dogs in a 10 minutes. Mayoi Ebihara, of Tokyo, Japan, came in second with 37 dogs, while Arizona’s Michelle Lesco finished third with 23.5 wieners. ​Sudo, a Florida native, beat her beef-eating competitors by a mile at the July 4 tradition. Her 28-year-old rival, Mayoi Ebihara, of Japan, came in second with 37 dogs, while Arizona’s Michelle Lesco, 40, finished third with 23.5 wieners.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Biden say 'I screwed up' on debate night? Details here
item.description: ​That President Joe Biden 'screwed up' the first presidential debate with Donald Trump is not a secret to himself but the President has now acknowledged the debacle in exact these words in a radio program on July 4. "I had a bad night. And the fact of the matter is that, you know, I screwed up," Biden said in an interview with radio host Earl Ingram. "I made a mistake. But I learned from my father, when you get knocked down, you just get back up. And you know, we're going to win this election," Biden said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: American Airlines flight makes emergency landing after passenger urinated, exposed himself
item.description: ​An American Airlines flight made an emergency landing in New York Wednesday after Neil McCarthy, a 25-year-old Oregon man, urinated in the aisle of the airplane and then exposed himself. The man was arrested and charged with indecent exposure and was later released after he appeared in a Buffalo federal court, New York Post reported.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Barron seems uncomfortable': Social media slams Donald Trump for leaked video
item.description: A video of Donald Trump dishing out some unpalatable comments about Joe Biden and Kamala Harris as he was probably chilling at a golf course got leaked Thursday making no one squirm for he's known for such comments. But social media users absolutely abhorred the fact that Trump did not even think twice about his 18-year-old son Barron Trump sitting next to him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'What the hell is happening': Why Hunter Biden keeping close watch on father
item.description: President Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden has been keeping a close watch on his father now following the debate disaster. The White House has clarified that Joe Biden is not opting out of the race but according to reports the entry of Hunter Biden, convicted of felony gun charges, into the official circle of the President has made White House staff members asking each other, "What the hell is happening?".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Beryl heads for Cayman Islands, Mexico after striking Jamaica
item.description: Hurricane Beryl targets Cayman Islands and Mexico after hitting Jamaica with severe winds and rain. Beryl, now Category 3, caused 10 deaths. PM Andrew Holness issued curfew. Grand Cayman faces life-threatening conditions. St. Vincent, Union Island, and Grenada were severely hit. Earlier Category 5. Amoy Wellington, NOAA, PM Ralph Gonsalves, and Richard Thompson confirm devastation.

item.title: The suspect in the attempted assassination of Slovakia's prime minister now faces terror charges
item.description: Slovakia's Prosecutor-General has charged the suspect in the May 15 assassination attempt on Prime Minister Robert Fico with terrorism. Initially charged with attempted murder, the suspect, identified as JC, allegedly acted with third-party support. Fico, a divisive figure known for his pro-Russia stance, is recovering from multiple wounds. The incident has sparked nationwide protests.

item.title: Tunisian police arrest candidate for presidential election
Who are King Charles & Royal family voting for in UK elections? They aren't
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: President Biden 'absolutely not' withdrawing – White House
DR Congo soldiers sentenced to death for fleeing battle
item.description: In North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo, 25 soldiers were sentenced to death for fleeing Rwanda-backed M23 rebels and theft. They deserted positions, stole goods, and were detained with wives. One got a 10-year sentence. Lawyer Jules Muvweko will appeal. Army spokesman Reagan Mbuyi Kalonji noted internal military divisions. Eight officers were sentenced to death in May.

item.title: Britons vote in parliamentary election expected to propel Labour to power

item.title: Hurricane Beryl roars toward Mexico after leaving destruction in Jamaica and eastern Caribbean
